titleStmt.title: Letter Requisitioning Sailors and Provisions for an Expedition
titleStmt.author: Kurrah ben Sharik

msContents.summary: Letter presumably from the governor of Egypt, Kurrah b. Sharik, to the pagarch, Basilius, ordering sailors and provisions

msItemStruct.note: Inv. 13332f has 12 lines of writing (= P.Ross.Georg. IV 5.1-12); the back is blank
Lines 42-45 of P.Ross.Georg. IV 5 are in a different hand; for a photo of lines 28-45, see P.Ross.Georg. IV, Tafel 1; an image of only inv. 13332f (lines 1-12) is provided here
For the date, see F. Morelli, Olio e retribuzioni (Firenze 1996), 106 n. 113
Hermitage inv. 13331f (=apis id 12) appears to belong to the beginning of this papyrus and is published at P.Ross.Georg. IV 5, p. 20

provenance.p: From the collection of N. Likhachov; once housed in the Paleographical Museum of the Academy of Science in St. Petersburg; now in the Hermitage Museum

taxonomy.desc: APIS keywords are controlled locally at the institution level. They are not necessarily consistent.

div.ab: Lines 42-45, List of requisitions thus: sailors, 16 individuals, payment . . . 1/2 solidus; in adaeratio of 2 months, from 1. solid., .[ ; of olive oil, 6 metra, 4 pints [.

listBibl.bibl: P.Ross.Georg. IV 5 BL VI, 122 and XI, 188; for discussion of the letters of Kurrah b. Sharik see H. Cadell, "Correspondance de Kurrah ben Sharik" Recherches de Papyrologie IV (1967), 107-160, esp. 133-160
